etymology.description: phonetic: 工 ‘work’ + semantic: 力 ‘strength’; also analyzed as ideogrammic: 工 + 力.
etymology.interpretation: 工 gives the sound gōng and the idea of work, while 力 adds the sense of strength or applied force. Together they evoke exerting strength in work, leading to effort, skill, and meritorious results.

examples.chinese: 为了取得好成绩(為了取得好成績)，他下了很大功夫(他下了很大功夫)。
examples.pinyin: Wèile qǔdé hǎo chéngjì, tā xiàle hěn dà gōngfu.
examples.english: To get good grades, he put in a lot of effort.

examples.chinese: 这次项目成功(這次項目成功)，多亏了大家的功劳(多虧了大家的功勞)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì xiàngmù chénggōng, duōkuī le dàjiā de gōngláo.
examples.english: The project’s success is thanks to everyone’s merit and contributions.

examples.chinese: 她在书法上的功夫很深(她在書法上的功夫很深)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài shūfǎ shàng de gōngfu hěn shēn.
examples.english: Her skill in calligraphy is profound.
